clusterConfig.description: Cluster config read from the cluster

createdAt.description: The time when this cluster was registered with Signadot.

operator.description: Information about the Signadot Operator in this cluster.

createdAt.description: The time when this cluster was registered with Signadot.

lastConnectedAt.description: The last time at which this token was used to connect.

lastConnectedIp.description: The last IP address from which this token connected.

cluster.description: Cluster that the resource is created in

sandbox.description: Name of the sandbox containing the resource

createdAt.description: The time at which the resource plugin was created

updatedAt.description: The time at which the resource plugin was last updated

enabled.description: Enabled = true, requires the definition of a valid routing context

publish.description:
Publish represents whether the test execution will show up by default
in the UI, i.e. to filter out ad-hoc and test the test usage.

timeout.description:
Timeout represents an optional timeout for the test execution.
If not supplied, it defaults to the DefaultTimeout of the associated
test, if that is present.  If that is not present, it defaults to "5m".
It should be a string representing an unsigned integer not exceeding 32 bits followed by
a units character, which can be one of the following.
  - 'm' for minutes
  - 'h' for hours
  - 'd' for days
  - 'w' for weeks

hosted.description: Hosted/External source information, these are one or the other

triggeredBy.description: info about the trigger of the execution, empty means a manual trigger

publish.description:
Publish represents whether the test execution will show up by default
in the UI, i.e. to filter out ad-hoc and test the test usage.

timeout.description:
Timeout represents an optional timeout for the test execution.
If not supplied, it defaults to the DefaultTimeout of the associated
test, if that is present.  If that is not present, it defaults to "5m".
It should be a string representing an unsigned integer not exceeding 32 bits followed by
a units character, which can be one of the following.
  - 'm' for minutes
  - 'h' for hours
  - 'd' for days
  - 'w' for weeks

defaultTimeout.description:
DefaultTimeout represents an optional default timeout for the test
executions associated with this test, which can override this value.
If not supplied, it defaults to "5m".  It should be a string
representing an unsigned integer in decimal not exceeding 32 bits
followed by a units character, which can be one of the following.
  - 'm' for minutes
  - 'h' for hours
  - 'd' for days
  - 'w' for weeks

executionTemplate.description: ExecutionTemplate specifies a template for creating the actual execution

sandboxOf.description:
SandboxOf specifies a workload that when being sandboxed, will
trigger an execution of the test (for now, only forks are supported)

version.description:
The operator version of the cluster.  This may be
nil if the cluster has not yet connected to Signadot.

enabled.description: Explicitly enable traffic manager in runner pods for this job.

injectRoutingKey.description:
InjectRoutingKey indicates if the system should perform automatic
injection of routing key headers or not.  It may be the empty string,
"auto" or "disabled".  The empty string defaults to meaning "disabled".
The "auto" value will overwrite the value of the Enabled field, setting
it to true.

jobTimeout.description:
JobTimeout specifies the max job execution time of jobs running with this
RunnerGroup.  If not specified, it defaults to 30 minutes ("30m")

reusePods.description:
ReusePods specifies whether JRG pods are reused after job executions.
If false (default), JRG pods are always recreated after each job.

name.description: Name of the entity within the Kubernetes cluster.

namespace.description: Namespace within which the entity lives in the Kubernetes cluster.

clusterID.description: ID of Authenticated Cluster, if any (via signadot-cluster-token header)

featureFlags.description: Feature Flags as result of authentication

userFlags.description: Flags of authenticated user, if any

namespace.description: Namespace to create this runner instance in

create.description: Create refers to the `create` steps for spinning up the resource

delete.description: Delete refers to the `delete` steps for spinning up the resource

resources.description: Resources created using the resource plugin

script.description: Script to execute in the step

as.description:
If the As field is not speficied, we will take the input name
uppercase it, convert "-" to "_", and inject it as an env var into
the main container

valueFromSandbox.description: ValueFromSandbox defines whether or not to source value from the sandbox spec

valueFromStep.description:
ValueFromStep is an optional string specifying the output of
another step when not nil.  Exactly one of ValueFromSandbox
and 'ValueFromStep != nil' must hold.

env.description:
Inject the input as an env variable with name Env inside the
main container

path.description: Expose the input as a file at Path inside the main container

valueFromPath.description: Path within the main container from where the output will be read

output.description: Name of the variable from the step

all.description:
When All is non-nil, T matches a set of labels if and only if every element of All matches them.
Only one field may be non-nil.

any.description:
When Any is non-nil, T matches a set of labels if and only if some element of Any matches them.
Only one field may be non-nil.

label.description:
When Label is non-nil, T matches a set of labels L if and only if t.Label.Matches(L).
Only one field may be non-nil.

key.description:
Key is an exact match on a label key, glob
characters are just considered normal characters.

value.description:
Value is a glob match for the value of a
sandbox label.  See https://pkg.go.dev/path/filepath#Match
for the file glob syntax.

cluster.description:
Cluster gives the cluster to which the route group applies.
If left empty, this RG will become a multi-cluster RG..

description.description: Description provides a short description of the route group.

endpoints.description:
Endpoints define endpoints which target different in-cluster
services.

match.description:
Match defines a matcher for labels, which matches
sandboxes that should be a part of this route group.

ttl.description: TTL define when/how the route group should be deleted

matchedSandboxes.description:
MatchedSandboxes gives the list of sandboxes whose labels
were matched by the 'match' object in the spec.

message.description:
Message is a human readable explanation of why
the sandbox is healthy or not.

ready.description:
Ready indicates whether the sandbox is ready,
meaning that it can be used for testing.

reason.description:
Reason is a machine readable explanation of why
the sandbox is healthy or not.

scheduledDeleteTime.description:
ScheduledDeleteTime returns the formatted and computed ttl based on the Duration
and OffsetFrom

duration.description:
Duration represents the duration until routegroup's end of life.
It should be an unsigned integer not exceeding 32 bits followed by
a units character, which can be one of the following.
  - 'm' for minutes
  - 'h' for hours
  - 'd' for days
  - 'w' for weeks

offsetFrom.description:
OffsetFrom indicates what the Duration is relative to.  It
may be the empty string, "noMatchedSandboxes", "createdAt" or "updatedAt". The empty string
defaults to meaning "noMatchedSandboxes".

env.description: Environment variable modifications that will be applied to the forked workload

images.description: One or more docker images that will be applied to the forked workload

container.description: name of container to which it applies

customizations.description: Customizations specify the customizations we will apply on the fork

forkOf.description:
ForkOf specifies the target workload that we will be forking.  In this usage
the Kind of the ForkOf object must not be a service.

port.description: Port it will map to on the forked workload

name.description: Name of the entity within the Kubernetes cluster.

namespace.description: Namespace within which the entity lives in the Kubernetes cluster.

host.description: Hostname that this endpoint points to

port.description: Port it will map to on the specified host

container.description: Container is the container this image must apply to in the forked workload

jobs.description: status of the jobs running in the context of the given sandbox

message.description:
Message is a human readable explanation of why
the sandbox is healthy or not.

ready.description:
Ready indicates whether the sandbox is ready,
meaning that it can be used for testing.

reason.description:
Reason is a machine readable explanation of why
the sandbox is healthy or not.

scheduledDeleteTime.description:
ScheduledDeleteTime returns the formatted and computed ttl based on the Duration
and OffsetFrom

testExecutions.description: status of the test executions running in the context of the given sandbox

cluster.description: Cluster within which this sandbox should be created

defaultRouteGroup.description: DefaultRouteGroup can be used to define route group endpoints for the sandbox.

description.description: Description of the purpose of this sandbox

disableSandboxTrafficManager.description:
DisableSandboxTrafficManager provides a way of turning off the sandbox
traffic manager for forks in this sandbox.
Deprecated in operators since v1.1. The sandbox traffic manager has been
retired.

forks.description: Forks is the specification of each forked entity

labels.description: Labels are used to specify metadata associated with the sandbox as key-value pairs.

resources.description: Resources specifies each required resource to spin up the sandbox

ttl.description:
TTL gives the maximum lifetime of the sandbox.
It may be empty, in which case it defaults to forever.

duration.description:
Duration represents the duration until sandbox end of life.
It should be an unsigned integer not exceeding 32 bits followed by
a units character, which can be one of the following.
  - 'm' for minutes
  - 'h' for hours
  - 'd' for days
  - 'w' for weeks

offsetFrom.description:
OffsetFrom indicates what the Duration is relative to.  It
may be the empty string, "createdAt" or "updatedAt".  The empty string
defaults to meaning "createdAt".

name.description: Name indicates the name of the associated parameter.

value.description:
Value indicates the value passed to the parameter of
the same name.

valueFrom.description: ValueFrom indicates from where to grab the value

match.description:
Matches specifies a disjunction of matching criteria for dispatching
the middleware.  Any empty list means don't dispatch anything.

workload.description:
Workload specifies a glob which matches
each workload name in the spec.

name.description: Name of the entity within the Kubernetes cluster.

namespace.description: Namespace within which the entity lives in the Kubernetes cluster.
